titleStmt.author: Case, William

monogr.title: A sermon of the nature and necessitie of godly feare : Preached in the Cathedrall Church of Chester, in September, 1614
monogr.author: Case, William

div.head: TO THE RIGHT WORSHIPFVLL Sir RANDALL CREVV Knight, one of his Maiesties Serieants at the LAVV.
div.p:
I Doe vnfainedly professe my selfe for euer bound vnto you, for your vndeserued goodnesse towards me, and your forward and willing inclination to entertaine me into your fauour. Which, as it doth require and challenge from mee all respectfull acknowledgement: so am I willing to take any occasion to witnesse the same, and for that cause am bold to present this small discourse vnto your Patronage, as a pledge of my vnfained thankefulnesse: humbly desiring you to yeelde vnto it your fauourable acceptance, vntill such time as
heereafter, I shall by some better meanes giue more pregnant testimony of my thankefull minde and dutifull deuotion. In the meane time I shall endeuour myselfe to deserue your good fauours, and will not cease to pray that the Almighty God may multiply vpon you and yours all the blessings and honours of this life, and after this life crowne you with immortall glory in CHRIST JESVS.

closer.signed: Your Worships humbly deuoted in the Lord Iesus WILLIAM CASE.
